data.title: Tokyo Feb core CPI rises 1.8% yr/yr
data.description:
TOKYO, Feb 27 (Reuters) - Core consumer prices in Tokyo rose 1.8% in February from a year earlier, government data showed on Friday.

The core consumer price index for Japan’s capital, which includes oil products but excludes fresh food prices, compared with economists' median estimate for a 1.7% annual rise.

(Reporting by Tokyo Newsroom)

data.title: MasTec Inc reports results for the quarter ended December 31 - Earnings Summary
data.description:
• MasTec Inc reported quarterly adjusted earnings of $2.48​​ per share for the quarter ended December 31, higher than the same quarter last year, when the company reported EPS of $1.44. The mean expectation of twenty analysts for the quarter was for earnings of $1.95 per share. Wall Street expected results to range from $2.25 to $2.40 per share.

  • Revenue rose 15.8% to $3.94 billion from a year ago; analysts expected $3.90 billion.

  • MasTec Inc's reported EPS for the quarter was $1.81​.

  • The company reported quarterly net income of $160.5 million.

  • MasTec Inc shares had risen by 31.2% this quarter.

FORECAST CHANGES

  • The mean earnings estimate of analysts had fallen by about 0.4% in the last three months.​

  • In the last 30 days, there have been no earnings estimate revisions by analysts covering the company.

RECOMMENDATIONS

  • The current average analyst rating on the shares is "buy" and the breakdown of recommendations is 20 "strong buy" or "buy," 2 "hold" and no "sell" or "strong sell." The average consensus recommendation for the construction & engineering peer group is also "buy"

  • Wall Street's median 12-month price target for MasTec Inc is $262.00, about 10.7% below its last closing price of $289.96

This summary was machine generated from LSEG data February 26 at 11:30 p.m. UTC. ​All figures in US dollars unless otherwise stated. data.title: Singapore's Olam Group annual profit jumps more than five-fold
data.description:
Singapore's Olam Group reported a more than five-fold jump in annual profit on Friday, helped by strong performance across its businesses.

Olam, one of the world's biggest agricultural commodities traders, posted profit attributable of S$444.1 million ($351.34 million) for the year ended December 31, compared with S$86.4 million last year.

($1 = 1.2640 Singapore dollars)

data.title: Aura Minerals Q4 net revenue surges on higher gold, copper prices
data.description:
Overview

  • Canada-based gold miner's Q4 net revenue rose 88% YoY

  • Adjusted EBITDA for Q4 hit record high, driven by higher production and metal prices

  • Company completed acquisition of MSG Gold Mine in December 2025

Outlook

  • Aura projects 2026 production to grow to 360,000–390,000 GEO

  • Company aims to exceed 600,000 GEO annually in coming years

  • Aura plans capacity expansions at Borborema and Almas

Result Drivers

  • HIGHER PRODUCTION - Aura's Q4 2025 production increased 23% YoY, driven by Borborema ramp-up and MSG acquisition

  • HIGHER METAL PRICES - Q4 2025 net revenue rose 88% YoY, aided by higher gold and copper prices

  • STABLE COSTS - Aura maintained stable costs, contributing to record Adjusted EBITDA in Q4 2025

data.title: Netflix to Invest $20B Content After Ceding Warner to Paramount — Market Talk
data.description: Netflix is doubling down on its own content after declining to up the ante in a bidding war with Paramount for Warner Bros. Discovery. Netflix invest about $20 billion in quality films and series this year and expand its entertaining offering, and also plans to resume its share buyback program. The company had signed a deal for Warner's studios and HBO Max for $72 billion. The deal was "a 'nice to have' at the right price, not a 'must have' at any price," Netflix's co-CEOs say in a statement. "Netflix's business is healthy, strong and growing organically, powered by our slate and best-in-class streaming service." (kelly.cloonan@wsj.com)
